name: Shipwright Quarter
role_in_state: Primary shipbuilding and maritime outfitting district
economy_niches: Artisan fittings and smithing for vessels
Reagent harvesting and preparation for hull-preserving rituals
culture_adjustments: Guild hierarchy and apprenticeship overtly shape daily life and legal standing
Work rhythm tied to tide-calendar more strictly than state norm
Rituals integrated into build process; material-magic pragmatism over doctrinal display
Stronger contractual language and notarized oral pledges than rural coastal areas
constraints: Ritual magic consumes scarce imported reagents
Waterfront space and slipways are highly constrained
Guild regulations limit rapid industrial expansion
notes: Seasonal tide festivals mark fleet delivery and apprentice elevation
Apprenticeship networks supply skilled labor across state fleets
